snippet: Misuse of attention deficit drugs has become a problem on campuses, and colleges are reconsidering how — and even if — their student health offices should try to diagnose A.D.H.D.
abstract: Dozens of colleges are tightening campus infirmary rules on diagnosis of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, or ADHD, and subsequent prescription of amphetamine-based medications like Vyvanse and Adderall; aim is to curb abuse of stimulant medications on campuses nationwide.
lead_paragraph: Misuse of attention deficit drugs has become a problem on campuses, and colleges are reconsidering how — and even if — their student health offices should try to diagnose A.D.H.D.

headline.seo: Colleges Tackle Illicit Use of A.D.H.D. Pills
headline.main: Attention-Deficit Drugs Face New Campus Rules
headline.print_headline: Attention-Deficit Drugs Face New Campus Rules
